title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 14 February 2017 - XWiki
content:
<Aranjedeath> has joined #xwiki  
06:51 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <Aranjedeath> has quit  
09:06 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:25 <mflorea> has quit  
09:45 <Pbas> has quit  
09:57 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:09 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
10:16 <Pbas> has joined #xwiki  
11:05 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:10 <Slashman> has quit  
11:10 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:30 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:36 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
13:11 <raphael29\_> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <prakhar123> has joined #xwiki  
15:00 <prakhar123> hi,i was installing xwiki on my laptop where i encountered this error "Error number 4001 in 4: Error while evaluating velocity template htmlheader.vm".I've already increased the size  following instruction "JAVA\_OPTS="-Djava.awt.headless=true -Xmx1024m".what should i do to solve the error,@tmortagne  
15:01 <tmortagne> prakhar123: this error does not means anything, you need to look at the log to have the detail  
15:03 <prakhar123> i'm sorry , i restarted my laptop and it worked.  
15:04 <tmortagne> ok  
15:18 <prakhar123> I would like to contribute to xwiki.please get me started @tmortagne  
15:20 <tmortagne> prakhar123: did you look at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Contributing ?  
15:21 <tmortagne> if it's for GSOC you should look at dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/Guidelines  
15:21 <tmortagne> http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/Guidelines  
15:26 <prakhar123> yes,i read the first link. I would like to apply at xwiki for gsoc this year.And i'm interested in project here:http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GoogleSummerOfCode/RedPenIntegration2017.I'm currently installing xwiki setup,  
15:28 <tmortagne> prakhar123: ok, great to see someone interested in contributing :) Unfortunately I can't tell you much about RedPen proposal and Vincent is won't be there until next week but you can try the mailing list  
15:28 <tmortagne> in the meantime I can probably help on more general questions  
15:33 <prakhar123> ok.will do that.one question-what is good time for converestaion on irc?  
15:34 <tmortagne> most of committers are on GMT +1 or +2 and connected between 8am and 18pm  
15:34 <tmortagne> but mailing list is active too  
15:35 <tmortagne> especially is you have more complex questions mailing list is good  
15:35 <prakhar123> thanks for kind information.  
15:35 <tmortagne> you're welcome :)  
15:52 <StefanT29\_> has joined #xwiki  
15:54 <tmortagne> has quit  
17:31 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
17:41 <prakhar123> has left #xwiki  
18:01 <M-cjd> Howdy folks  
18:02 <M-cjd> got an interesting issue we detected working on the expense report app  
18:03 <M-cjd> $xwiki.getDocument($request.page).getObject('ERCode.ERCodeDetailClass', $mathtool.toNumber($request.number))   --> seems that if $request.number is out of range of existing objects, it will just return you the first object rather than making a new one  
18:04 <OSIMasson1> has joined #xwiki  
18:04 <M-cjd> And it seems that the app was developed with the intent of making new objects using this API so it might be something worth looking in to, whether it could have been a regression  
18:04 <systemd> has quit  
18:10 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
18:20 <tmortagne> M-cjd: that's not what I see in the code, if the nb is too big you should get null  
18:20 <tmortagne> see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/doc/XWikiDocument.java#L2584  
18:20 <M-cjd> hmm Pierre was saying that he seemed to be getting the first object from the document, anyway thanks  
18:21 <M-cjd> https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/api/Document.java#L1242  
18:22 <M-cjd> seems it should be making a new object but somehow it is not -- which is what you get if you have some exception  
18:22 <tmortagne> yes you get null if XWikiDocument#getObject return null  
18:22 <tmortagne> newObjectApi is not creating a new object  
18:22 <tmortagne> newObjectApi convert BaseObject to Object  
18:22 <M-cjd> ahh ok  
18:23 <M-cjd> ahh yeah, indeed it should be null  
18:23 <tmortagne> so only when there is an object to return  
18:23 <tmortagne> (and yes the method name is pretty bad)  
18:39 <mflorea> has quit  
18:41 <ol-ow2> has joined #xwiki  
18:43 <ol-ow2> Hi, where is the location of the macro attchment ? (page or vm ?)  
18:44 <evalica> @ol-ow2 if you look at http://playground.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/WikiMacros it contains wiki macros. if it's in that list, it's in the page, otherwise in java. there are also vm macros. Not sure which macros you are talking about.  
18:46 <ol-ow2> thanks evalica  
18:47 <ol-ow2> i made a mistake, indeed i'm looking for attachementSelector velocity macro  
18:47 <ol-ow2> (xwiki 6.4.4)  
18:52 <ol-ow2> hum.. bundle since v3.0  
18:52 <ol-ow2> i get an unknow macro error  
19:02 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
19:04 <systemd> has joined #xwiki  
19:05 <M-cjd> Ok we found the issue and fixed it, this one is beautiful, we has doc.getObject("blah", $mathtool.toNumber($request.number))  and it was not working  
19:06 <M-cjd> changed it to $mathtool.toInteger($request.number) and bam it works  
19:07 <systemd> has quit  
19:07 <M-cjd> looks like what happened was getObject(String, Double) was matching better to a newly added (?) function getObject(String, boolean) than getObject(String, int) which was intended  
19:07 <M-cjd> so basically adding a function can break things  
19:07 <systemd> has joined #xwiki  
19:18 <tmortagne> Enygma`: looks like you forgot to set the locales in http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/Data/XWiki/9.0/#HTranslations  
19:24 <tmortagne> has quit  
19:29 <ol-ow2> has left #xwiki  
20:00 <evalica> has quit  
20:03 <Slashman> has quit  
20:09 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
20:24 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> has joined #xwiki  
20:26 <xwikiorg\_guest\_1> hi, does xwiki9 support Visio webdrawings (web parts) ? From what I can find so far it has been requested in 2009, but I can't find a formal answer or any kind of implementation detail/release note
